Description: Green glazed composition shabti of Horsaiset with a lappet-wig, a modelled face with a beard, crossed hands in relief holding a relief hoe and an adze, the front of the leg section is inscribed with hieroglyphs (now illegible), the flat back is decorated with a representation of a seed-basket and the back-pillar is inscribed with incised Hieroglyphs, there is short plinth beneath the feet.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Somerset Lowry-Corry, 2nd Earl of Belmore
